title: Unlicensed beautician pleads guilty to negligent HOMICIDE after performing botched butt injections
text:
A British woman who was extradited to New York from the United Kingdom pleaded guilty in a Queens court on Friday to causing the death of another woman through a botched butt enhancement.

Donna Francis, 39, pleaded guilty to criminally negligent homicide during a hearing at Queens County Criminal Court on Friday.

She was initially indicted in 2016 for the death of Kelly Mayhew, a television producer from Maryland who paid $1,600 to have the procedure in Francis' basement in 2015.

As per the terms of her extradition, she faces no more than a year in prison. Sentencing is scheduled for November 14.

Donna Francis, 39, will serve no more than a year in prison for the May 2015 death of a television producer from Maryland. She is seen above in Queens County Criminal Court in New York on Friday

Francis, a British national, fled to the United Kingdom and fought extradition. She was extradited to the United States in August

The extradition order also requires that Francis serve her sentence in Suffolk County, Long Island, rather than the notorious Rikers Island detention facility.

Acting Queens District Attorney John Ryan says Francis injected Mayhew's buttocks with silicone gel purchased from eBay in the basement of her home in the Far Rockaway neighborhood on May 30, 2015.

Authorities say the silicone entered Mayhew's bloodstream and killed her.

'In pleading guilty, the defendant has now admitted to causing the death of a young woman who sought a cosmetic procedure at a discount and paid with her life,' Ryan said.

'The defendant set up shop in the basement of a Far Rockaway home using a massage table for an examination table and silicone gel that had been purchased from the website Ebay.

Mayhew, a television producer from Maryland, paid $1,600 to have the procedure in Francis' basement in 2015

'The victim in this case traveled from Maryland with her mother and paid $1,600 cash for the injections.

'Sadly, the treatment killed her.

'She went into cardiac arrest as the defendant pumped a clear liquid substance into the woman’s backside.

'The defendant, who fought extradition, will serve time behind bars as a result of her actions.'

Francis fled to London and was extradited in August.

Authorities said she began showing signs of distress after her second injection of silicone

Mayhew, 34, and her mother had traveled from their home in Suitland, Maryland, for the procedure.

According to authorities, Mayhew began showing signs of distress after she was administered a second injection.

Her mother dialed 911. Emergency responders found Mayhew lying unresponsive face up at the bottom of the stairs.

She was rushed to a nearby hospital and pronounced dead, according to the District Attorney's Office.

The medical examiner determined that the official cause of death was systemic silicone emboli.

Francis fled the scene and left the country the next day, according to Ryan.

The botched procedure was performed in the basement of Francis' home in Far Rockaway, Queens (above)

Francis' attorney, Kevin O'Donnell, says his client is 'incredibly remorseful.'

Francis fought extradition to the U.S., but a British judge ruled in October that the severity of the crime necessitated that the mother-of-one be sent to New York for trial.

Francis' daughter will be cared for by her maternal grandmother during the course of her sentence.

Francis was found to be suffering from a non-psychotic moderate to severe depressive episode.
description: Donna Francis (left), 39, pleaded guilty to criminally negligent homicide during a hearing at Queens County Criminal Court on Friday. In May 2015, she injected Kelly Mayhew (right) with silicone.
